meanings.definition: Filled with or made of nog.
meanings.sent1: The nogged cup was perfect for holding warm cocoa.
meanings.sent2: The cozy room had a nogged fireplace that added charm.
meanings.sent3: The nogged blanket kept me snug as a bug in a rug.
meanings.sent4: Her nogged heart was full of holiday cheer.
meanings.sent5: The nogged walls made the house feel like a winter wonderland.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike, especially on the head.
meanings.sent1: He nogged the ball with his head during the game.
meanings.sent2: The mischievous elf nogged Santa on the noggin with a snowball.
meanings.sent3: The little boy nogged his brother playfully with a pillow.
meanings.sent4: She nogged her friend on the head to get their attention.
meanings.sent5: The comedian nogged the audience with a witty punchline.

meanings.definition: To decorate or finish with wooden panels.
meanings.sent1: They nogged the cabin walls with beautiful pine panels.
meanings.sent2: The old farmhouse was nogged with intricate woodwork.
meanings.sent3: She nogged the stage backdrop with rustic wooden panels.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter nogged the door with mahogany for a rich look.
meanings.sent5: The restaurant was nogged with elegant oak panels for a classic feel.
